intro: Synotis rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined synotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are usually elliptical with prominent red veins, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
